results.title: Coronary counter attack
results.brief_description: Outlines heart disease risk factors, and argues that aerobic exercise will reduce these risks. Gives guidelines for such selected activities as jogging, swimming, bicycling, walking, rope jumping and cross-country skiing. Featuring Dr Kenneth H. Cooper.

results.title: Coromby - every Monday night
results.brief_description:
One of 6 works created in 2003 by community artist Malcolm McKinnon specifically for the MAP project. Each of the 6 works focuses on a different aspect of memory and identity in the Wimmera/Mallee region.
The Coromby Brass Band is a group of farmers who come together every Monday night to practice in a draughty hall beside the wheat silos on a back road outside the small town of Murtoa. Formed in 1891, the band is the oldest continuously active brass band in Australia. Many members have been involved for decades - in some cases, their fathers and grandfathers played in the band before them. In this film, members of the band talk about what keeps them turning up at the hall “every Monday night”.

results.title: Cornish Valley
results.creator_credit: Great Britain. Ministry of Information and Verity Films
results.brief_description: A study of family life on farms in the Coombe Valley near the border of north Cornwall and Devon, an area fairly typical of the south-west peninsula of England, with open, wind-swept uplands, deep sheltered valleys, steep slopes and small fields.

results.title: Cornflakes for tea
results.creator_credit: John Colquhoun, Tom Broadbridge and Andromeda Productions
results.brief_description: Dramatization of how a family living in high-rise inner city flats manage to cope with caring for each other when first their mother and then their father abandon them. Provides many points which could act as stimulus for discussion including perspectives on family relationships, contrasts on single parent and conventional nuclear families, welfare workers and their role, supportive community members, and the warm relationship of the central characters.

results.title: Cornet at night
results.creator_credit: Stanley Jackson, Peter Jones and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Tells a haunting story of boyhood on a prairie homestead. The boy, sent to town to find a strong hired hand, returns with a cornet player creating a tense atmosphere at supper. Later while milking, the farmer listens to the cornet, and understands that the boy’s need for music is as great as his own need for adequate help in the fields. The cornet player does not stay, but the echo of his music continues through the years. Based on a story by Sinclair Ross. (Awards: New York)

results.title: Cormorant fishing
results.brief_description: Introducing cormorant fishing, a very old and unusual method of fishing using the cormorant bird. This has become an annual event - a festival on the Nagara River at Gifu near Nagoya, attracting visitors from all over the world.

results.title: Cork in Portugal
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the economic importance of cork production to Portugal and its people, and describes the role of the cork worker in a changing industry. Examines the way in which cork is harvested, processed and manufactured into a wide variety of products which are used all over the world.

results.title: Coriolanus
results.brief_description: Coriolanus is the name given to an honourable but arrogant patrician, Caius Martius, after capturing the town of Corioli where a plebeian uprising has occurred. He rises to distinction, but through his pride and insincerity does not govern well. He is sent into exile by the Senators after he criticises them harshly in the Forum. Scorned, he joins forces with the uprisers and plans to sack Rome. It is only through the intervention of his wife and his mother that he revokes this decision and enters into a peace treaty with the Senators.

results.title: Corduroy and 4 other bear stories
results.brief_description: Five children’s stories including the lovable “Corduroy” by Don Freeman, a bear with no owner; “The Bear and the fly” by Paula Winter which tells about a hilarious disaster at dinner time; “Blueberries for Sal” by Robert McCloskey has Sal and her bear ending up with the wrong mother; “Panama” tells of a bear and a tiger who search for Panama, the land of their dreams in this story by Janosch; Frank Asch’s story “Happy Birthday Moon” is a story about love and friendship.

results.title: Corduroy (K)
results.creator_credit: Gary Templeton, Joe Mantegna, Weston Woods Studios and Evergreen/Firehouse Productions
results.brief_description: The film follows the adventures of a stuffed teddy bear called Corduroy who waits to be selected from the shelves of a department store. To make sure he is not mistaken for used property, he embarks on a quest to find a button that is missing from his overalls. In the process, he discovers a new and deserving owner. Based on the the book by Don Freeman.
